commit_message:
Move create-update-delete-stack-inplace test

Move to stable create-update-delete-stack-inplace test.
The test was broken because of bug in heat, so added
dependency on this bug.
The bug was actually related to updating of nested
stacks in heat. The new validation was added to heat
and it fails with validation error in some cases.

Change-Id: I8d0a5e4a8df202cdff57e0f7cceb804d470612aa
Depends-On: Ibb71f31f2ec7d1d37b995323a2474b799ea498bb

commit_message:
Remove db layer hard-code permission checks for network_get_by_uuid

This patches removes db layer hard-code permission checks for
network_get_by_uuid.

It is called by the follow function:
  1. network_api.get, context is elevated.
  2. delete_network, context is elevated.
  3. get_network, context is elevated.

Partially implements bp v3-api-policy

Change-Id: I2b75d0fe502aa27bf1c8994cdbac55ec173f70ed

Implementation for FWaaS insertion model to associate a Firewall
with specified Routers as opposed to the current model of association
with all Routers in the tenant.

- extension and new table tracking associated routers

- changes to plugin - agent interface (adding router associations)
- fw agent changes to pick up router associations from plugin

Implements: blueprint fwaas-router-insertion

commit_message:
FWaaS Insertion Model on Routers

Implementation for FWaaS insertion model to associate a Firewall
with specified Routers as opposed to the current model of association
with all Routers in the tenant.

- extension and new table tracking associated routers
- plugin changes to manage router association
- changes to plugin - agent interface (adding router associations)
- fw agent changes to pick up router associations from plugin
- UT changes
- Upgrade script

APIImpact
DocImpact

Change-Id: I0eba4b0aa127738397e6b9c45556e207216d79c7
Implements: blueprint fwaas-router-insertion

This removes the use of the context parameter in remotable methods

commit_message:
Remove usage of remotable context parameter in migration, network

This removes the use of the context parameter in remotable methods
in these objects. This is a precursor to actually removing the
context from the call, but we need to remove dependence on the
argument first. Remotable methods should be using the bundled object
context.

Related to blueprint kilo-objects

Change-Id: I511080f2980a47c2f2b96150c78609ab79b24b1d

commit_message:
Remove db layer hard-code permission checks for network_get_by_cidr

This patches removes db layer hard-code permission checks for
network_get_by_cidr.

It is called by the follow function:
  1. delete_network in network/manager.py, and context is elevated.
  2. modify in cmd/manage.py, the context is admin context

Partially implements bp v3-api-policy

Change-Id: I0cb02cf1fe5764558441acda5262d2c7928cebf3

commit_message:
Fix some issues with pool name sent to SVC

Add quotes around a pool name so a pool name with
imbedded spaces is a single argument when it arrives
on the SVC

What is happening today is SVC returns a usage
error and fails the request.

Update unit tests to verify quotes where added.

Closes-Bug: 1422903

Change-Id: Ic96304b907913dd8b11a583f03d169f314d851de

subject: Allow heat-standalone to work with keystone v3
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 970, 'name': 'Dean Troyer', 'email': 'dtroyer@gmail.com', 'username': 'dtroyer'}, {'_account_id': 1653, 'name': 'garyk', 'email': 'gkotton@vmware.com', 'username': 'garyk'}, {'_account_id': 2750, 'name': 'Sean Dague', 'email': 'sean@dague.net', 'username': 'sdague'}, {'_account_id': 4571, 'name': 'Steve Baker', 'email': 'sbaker@redhat.com', 'username': 'steve-stevebaker'}, {'_account_id': 7118, 'name': 'Ian Wienand', 'email': 'iwienand@redhat.com', 'username': 'iwienand'}, {'_account_id': 8871, 'name': 'Elastic Recheck', 'username': 'elasticrecheck'}, {'_account_id': 10385, 'name': 'Citrix XenServer CI', 'username': 'citrix_xenserver_ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
revisions:
[{'number': 7, 'created': '2015-03-17 22:14:50.000000000', 'files': ['lib/heat', 'stack.sh'], 'message': "Allow heat-standalone to work with keystone v3

Heat can now run in standalone mode with the default v3 keystone
backend.

This change removes the installation of the v2 contrib backend.
It also configures saner defaults when HEAT_STANDALONE is True.
Using trusts and a stack-domain will never work in standalone mode
since they both require a service user which doesn't exist in
standalone mode.

Finally, this change prevents heat.conf being populated with service user options
not required by standalone mode.

Configuring the v2 backend may be reintroduced later with a dedicated
flag variable.

Change-Id: I88403e359e5e59e776b25ba1b65fae6fa8a3548e
"}]
commit_message:
Allow heat-standalone to work with keystone v3

Heat can now run in standalone mode with the default v3 keystone
backend.

This change removes the installation of the v2 contrib backend.
It also configures saner defaults when HEAT_STANDALONE is True.
Using trusts and a stack-domain will never work in standalone mode
since they both require a service user which doesn't exist in
standalone mode.

Finally, this change prevents heat.conf being populated with service user options
not required by standalone mode.

Configuring the v2 backend may be reintroduced later with a dedicated
flag variable.

Change-Id: I88403e359e5e59e776b25ba1b65fae6fa8a3548e

commit_message:
Remove usage of remotable context parameter in compute_node, keypair

This removes the use of the context parameter in remotable methods
in these objects. This is a precursor to actually removing the
context from the call, but we need to remove dependence on the
argument first. Remotable methods should be using the bundled object
context.

Related to blueprint kilo-objects

Change-Id: Ia9697e8301606eda3e845ea8e10016f24790ed16

All non-keyword arguments are converted to strings and written to
the stream, the argument "sys.stderr" should be given keyword
"file" as keyword argument.

subject: Magnum - OpenStack Containers Service
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-03-18 05:30:09.000000000', 'files': ['reference/projects.yaml'], 'message': "Magnum - OpenStack Containers Service

Addition of the Magnum Project - a collaboration of 24 engineers
from 13 affiliations to bring containers to Openstack as a first
class resource. We just concluded our Midcycle meetup.

Magnum builds on Heat to produce Nova instances on which to run
application containers. It is licensed under Apache 2.0, and all
contributors have signed an OpenStack CLA.

All library dependencies allow for unrestricted distribution and
deployment. Our PTL is chosen by our contributors, and holds
weekly IRC meetings in #openstack-meeting-alt and are logged using
Meetbot. We are also available in #openstack-containers to for
daily discussion and as a way for users to converse with our
developers openly.

All Magnum source code is posted to Gerrit, and reviewed. We allow
code merge after two +2 votes. Our code is automatically unit
tested by the OpenStack CI infrastructure. Our PTL serves as a
contact for cross-project teams in OpenStack.

We make extensive use of existing software, and have not
deliberately reproduced functionality that already exists in other
ecosystem projects. Magnum doesn't compete with Swarm, Docker, or
Kubernetes, but instead offers a user experience that integrates
those systems for use with OpenStack. We are open to integrating
best-of-breed technologies that help OpenStack operators offer
application containers to their cloud users.

We have implemented Magnum using the oslo common libraries and
the Pecan+WSME WSGI framework. Magnum completely conforms to the
OpenStack development style.

Project direction has been publically discussed at the Oregon
Nova Midcycle, the Paris OpenStack Design Summit, and in March
2015 at the Magnum Midcycle in San Francisco.

We use the openstack-dev ML for project discussion and do not use
any other mailing lists.

Magnum is compatible with OpenStack APIs, and uses Keystone
middleware to integrate with OpenStack Identity. All per-tenant
Magnum infrastructure is deployed using OpenStack Orchestration
using HOT files.

There are numerous active contributors from several affiliations
who have allocated full-time engineers to contribute to Magnum.

Magnum is different from Nova, because it provides a purpose built
API to manage application containers, which have a distinctly
different lifecycle and operations than Nova (machine) Instances.

Magnum is also different from Docker and Kubernetes, by offering
an asynchronous REST API that's compatible with Keystone, and a
complete multi-tenancy implementation. It does not perform
orchestration internally, and instead relies on OpenStack
Orchestration.

Change-Id: Ib1e28dca958e0cdc2b84460cef70744788fec2b0
"}]
commit_message:
Magnum - OpenStack Containers Service

Addition of the Magnum Project - a collaboration of 24 engineers
from 13 affiliations to bring containers to Openstack as a first
class resource. We just concluded our Midcycle meetup.

Magnum builds on Heat to produce Nova instances on which to run
application containers. It is licensed under Apache 2.0, and all
contributors have signed an OpenStack CLA.

All library dependencies allow for unrestricted distribution and
deployment. Our PTL is chosen by our contributors, and holds
weekly IRC meetings in #openstack-meeting-alt and are logged using
Meetbot. We are also available in #openstack-containers to for
daily discussion and as a way for users to converse with our
developers openly.

All Magnum source code is posted to Gerrit, and reviewed. We allow
code merge after two +2 votes. Our code is automatically unit
tested by the OpenStack CI infrastructure. Our PTL serves as a
contact for cross-project teams in OpenStack.

We make extensive use of existing software, and have not
deliberately reproduced functionality that already exists in other
ecosystem projects. Magnum doesn't compete with Swarm, Docker, or
Kubernetes, but instead offers a user experience that integrates
those systems for use with OpenStack. We are open to integrating
best-of-breed technologies that help OpenStack operators offer
application containers to their cloud users.

We have implemented Magnum using the oslo common libraries and
the Pecan+WSME WSGI framework. Magnum completely conforms to the
OpenStack development style.

Project direction has been publically discussed at the Oregon
Nova Midcycle, the Paris OpenStack Design Summit, and in March
2015 at the Magnum Midcycle in San Francisco.

We use the openstack-dev ML for project discussion and do not use
any other mailing lists.

Magnum is compatible with OpenStack APIs, and uses Keystone
middleware to integrate with OpenStack Identity. All per-tenant
Magnum infrastructure is deployed using OpenStack Orchestration
using HOT files.

There are numerous active contributors from several affiliations
who have allocated full-time engineers to contribute to Magnum.

Magnum is different from Nova, because it provides a purpose built
API to manage application containers, which have a distinctly
different lifecycle and operations than Nova (machine) Instances.

Magnum is also different from Docker and Kubernetes, by offering
an asynchronous REST API that's compatible with Keystone, and a
complete multi-tenancy implementation. It does not perform
orchestration internally, and instead relies on OpenStack
Orchestration.

Change-Id: Ib1e28dca958e0cdc2b84460cef70744788fec2b0

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 1726, 'name': 'Ghe Rivero', 'email': 'ghe.rivero@gmail.com', 'username': 'ghe.rivero'}, {'_account_id': 6488, 'name': 'Clint Byrum', 'email': 'clint@fewbar.com', 'username': 'clint-fewbar'}, {'_account_id': 8399, 'name': 'Jay Dobies', 'email': 'jason.dobies@redhat.com', 'username': 'jdob'}, {'_account_id': 8449, 'name': 'Marios Andreou', 'email': 'marios.andreou@gmail.com', 'username': 'marios'}, {'_account_id': 9453, 'name': 'James Polley', 'email': 'jp@jamezpolley.com', 'username': 'tchaypo'}, {'_account_id': 14611, 'name': 'dasm', 'display_name': 'dasm', 'email': 'dsmigiel@redhat.com', 'username': 'dasm'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2015-02-06 15:55:13.000000000', 'files': ['scripts/acquire-image'], 'message': 'Get external images for a deployment.

Using the acquire-image script, we can cache locally images from an
external repository where they have been already built.

This time, it is NOT embedded in the devtest logic, and should be used
before building the images.

Usage:
acquire-image --download DOWNLOAD_URL [options] IMAGE_SET
where options can be --help and -c (check for local copies).

The metadata file, IMAGE_SET, is a json file with the following
structure:

{"images": [
  "image1_control.qcow2",
  "image2_compute.qcow2",
  "image3_compute_ha.qcow2",
  ...
]}

The image provider can have several images collections (scale vs. no_scale,
fedora vs. ubuntu, amd64 vs i386), so the clients can use the most
suitable for them.

Change-Id: I20858c4201caf45d46e098503fff7759af2cc34f
'}]
commit_message:
Get external images for a deployment.

Using the acquire-image script, we can cache locally images from an
external repository where they have been already built.

This time, it is NOT embedded in the devtest logic, and should be used
before building the images.

Usage:
acquire-image --download DOWNLOAD_URL [options] IMAGE_SET
where options can be --help and -c (check for local copies).

The metadata file, IMAGE_SET, is a json file with the following
structure:

{"images": [
  "image1_control.qcow2",
  "image2_compute.qcow2",
  "image3_compute_ha.qcow2",
  ...
]}

The image provider can have several images collections (scale vs. no_scale,
fedora vs. ubuntu, amd64 vs i386), so the clients can use the most
suitable for them.

Change-Id: I20858c4201caf45d46e098503fff7759af2cc34f

commit_message:
LBaaS reference implementation driver to support TLS

Including plugin modifications for barbican container retrieval
Including template updates to support TLS and SNI
Including jinja_config updates to support storing of the container details
Including driver updates for data directory locations

Implement blueprint lbaas-ref-impl-tls-support

Change-Id: Ie6d09780bc6e617ca2be15ee2378f7f51f08218d

subject: Remove configure_cinder_backend_conf_lvm
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 10385, 'name': 'Citrix XenServer CI', 'username': 'citrix_xenserver_ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-03-18 03:38:29.000000000', 'files': ['lib/cinder_backends/lvm', 'lib/cinder'], 'message': "Remove configure_cinder_backend_conf_lvm

Setting the local device filter like we were doing here
doesn't actually solve the problem.  We actually need to
set a global filter.

Submitted change: I5d5c48e188cbb9b4208096736807f082bce524e8

Once that lands this code won't be necessary at all and should
be removed.  We'll also remove the local conf usage in Cinder,
but currently that's harmless as it's designed to detect if
the local lvm.conf file exists in the cinder directory and
behave appropriately based on it's existence.

Change-Id: Iba701a8cb00ef7ce5acd675e8714ad471fb4cb37
"}]
commit_message:
Remove configure_cinder_backend_conf_lvm

Setting the local device filter like we were doing here
doesn't actually solve the problem.  We actually need to
set a global filter.

Submitted change: I5d5c48e188cbb9b4208096736807f082bce524e8

Once that lands this code won't be necessary at all and should
be removed.  We'll also remove the local conf usage in Cinder,
but currently that's harmless as it's designed to detect if
the local lvm.conf file exists in the cinder directory and
behave appropriately based on it's existence.

Change-Id: Iba701a8cb00ef7ce5acd675e8714ad471fb4cb37

commit_message:
Add uefi support for agent iscsi deploy

This commit adds uefi support for agent iscsi
deploy using pxe_* and iscsi_ilo drivers.
The image.install_bootloader extension in agent
now accepts a new parameter efi_system_part_uuid
which will be used for boot loader installation in
uefi boot mode.  We identify the efi system partition's
uuid after deploying the image and pass this information
to agent ramdisk while installing boot loader.

Depends-On: I8fbb4b2ebdff991d41c7b618a4d654af26311a56
Implements: blueprint local-boot-support-with-partition-images
Change-Id: Ic7337fa1b0a5aefd3137b754acc88c547fc7e9e2

commit_message:
Fixes misspelling in ch_creating_images_manually

In text: "The following example shows how to use the qemu-img
command to create an empty image file virt-install command to
start up a virtual machine using that image file".

Seems to have to be: "The following example shows how to use
the qemu-img command to create an empty image file, and
virt-install command to start up a virtual machine using
that image file" ("and" missed).

Change-Id: I3a4dc48261403a205b3ab80cbf98ab730b2689f5
Closes-bug: #1431290

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-03-17 17:44:34.000000000', 'files': ['doc/install-guide/section_keystone-services.xml'], 'message': 'Describe API endpoints in "Create the service entity and API" page

The Install Guide has a page which lists instructions for creating
the API endpoints. It mentions the public, admin, and internal API
endpoints, and mentions that they might be on separate networks for

between the endpoints. This change adds description of the API

commit_message:
Describe API endpoints in "Create the service entity and API" page

The Install Guide has a page which lists instructions for creating
the API endpoints. It mentions the public, admin, and internal API
endpoints, and mentions that they might be on separate networks for
security reasons, but there is no description of the differences
between the endpoints. This change adds description of the API
endpoints and lists examples of the networks that might be used.
The latest patchset tightens up one sentence as suggested in the
comments of patchset 1.

Change-Id: I8bcf1a765d187919c3f5718e24d1e362723f36db
Closes-Bug: #1432801

commit_message:
Adds FWaaS driver for Cisco CSR1kv

Support for Cisco CSR1kv Firewall:
Add CSR1kv firewall service helper that interworks with Cisco firewall
plugin via RPC.
Add CSR1kv firewall ACL driver that configures CSR1kv via CSR RESTAPI.

Implements: blueprint fwaas-cisco

commit_message:
Add Puppet 4.x lint checks

This changes the puppet-lint requirement to 1.1.x, so that we can use
puppet-lint plugins. Most of these plugins are for 4.x compat, but some
just catch common errors.

Change-Id: I5d8988653943631d5d2179702de1220263b67850
Signed-off-by: Gael Chamoulaud <gchamoul@redhat.com>

subject: Ensure return code passes through output trimming
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 7217, 'name': 'Hugh Saunders', 'email': 'hugh@wherenow.org', 'username': 'hughsaunders'}, {'_account_id': 7353, 'name': 'Kevin Carter', 'email': 'kevin@cloudnull.com', 'username': 'cloudnull'}, {'_account_id': 7414, 'name': 'David Wilde', 'email': 'dwilde@redhat.com', 'username': 'd34dh0r53'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-03-17 19:14:01.000000000', 'files': ['scripts/gate-check-commit.sh'], 'message': 'Ensure return code passes through output trimming

Currently the output of run-playbooks is filtered through an awk
statement to reduce the verbosity of the output. The problem is that
bash uses the return code from the right most command to determine the
return code for the whole pipe. Awk successfully processes the
run-playbooks output, even if run-playbooks fails, so awk returns 0, and
the pipeline is assumed to have completed successfully.

From the bash manual:

"Each command in a pipeline is executed in its own subshell (see Command
Execution Environment). The exit status of a pipeline is the exit status
of the last command in the pipeline, unless the pipefail option is
enabled (see The Set Builtin). If pipefail is enabled, the pipeline’s
return status is the value of the last (rightmost) command to exit with
a non-zero status, or zero if all commands exit successfully. If the
reserved word ‘!’ precedes the pipeline, the exit status is the logical
negation of the exit status as described above. The shell waits for all
commands in the pipeline to terminate before returning a value."

By enabling pipefail, we can ensure that the pipeline exits non-zero if
the run-playbooks script fails.

Closes-bug: #1432295
Change-Id: I019141a7bfbcfa817b90e39f4ae1a68eb3f269a5
(cherry picked from commit b76d43e8c60bcb3060ee4ee99b6fac8acf0650fb)
'}]
commit_message:
Ensure return code passes through output trimming

Currently the output of run-playbooks is filtered through an awk
statement to reduce the verbosity of the output. The problem is that
bash uses the return code from the right most command to determine the
return code for the whole pipe. Awk successfully processes the
run-playbooks output, even if run-playbooks fails, so awk returns 0, and
the pipeline is assumed to have completed successfully.

From the bash manual:

"Each command in a pipeline is executed in its own subshell (see Command
Execution Environment). The exit status of a pipeline is the exit status
of the last command in the pipeline, unless the pipefail option is
enabled (see The Set Builtin). If pipefail is enabled, the pipeline’s
return status is the value of the last (rightmost) command to exit with
a non-zero status, or zero if all commands exit successfully. If the
reserved word ‘!’ precedes the pipeline, the exit status is the logical
negation of the exit status as described above. The shell waits for all
commands in the pipeline to terminate before returning a value."

By enabling pipefail, we can ensure that the pipeline exits non-zero if
the run-playbooks script fails.

Closes-bug: #1432295
Change-Id: I019141a7bfbcfa817b90e39f4ae1a68eb3f269a5
(cherry picked from commit b76d43e8c60bcb3060ee4ee99b6fac8acf0650fb)

subject: Adjust method for trimming ansible output debug information
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 6816, 'name': 'Jesse Pretorius', 'email': 'jesse@odyssey4.me', 'username': 'jesse-pretorius'}, {'_account_id': 7353, 'name': 'Kevin Carter', 'email': 'kevin@cloudnull.com', 'username': 'cloudnull'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 7, 'created': '2015-03-17 14:05:56.000000000', 'files': ['scripts/gate-check-commit.sh'], 'message': 'Adjust method for trimming ansible output debug information

This patch adjusts the method introduced in
I98fb57a56c1b7ddd6558e265cf6e65b159a05123 to trim the debug information
from the ansible output.

This adjustment allows the output to come to the console immediately,
instead of piping to a file and doing the processing after the ansible
run is complete. It also ensures that the return code passes through the
output trimming.

This commit combines the following cherry-picks:
- ed090eb1094472dcef755e6ca319310e5a0e7eac
- b76d43e8c60bcb3060ee4ee99b6fac8acf0650fb

Partial-bug: #1425482
Closes-bug: #1432295
Co-Authored-By: Hugh Saunders <hugh@wherenow.org>
Change-Id: I515adcad34ef76b8ea47fe90bc6572fb3aec1d2c
'}]
commit_message:
Adjust method for trimming ansible output debug information

This patch adjusts the method introduced in
I98fb57a56c1b7ddd6558e265cf6e65b159a05123 to trim the debug information
from the ansible output.

This adjustment allows the output to come to the console immediately,
instead of piping to a file and doing the processing after the ansible
run is complete. It also ensures that the return code passes through the
output trimming.

This commit combines the following cherry-picks:
- ed090eb1094472dcef755e6ca319310e5a0e7eac
- b76d43e8c60bcb3060ee4ee99b6fac8acf0650fb

Partial-bug: #1425482
Closes-bug: #1432295
Co-Authored-By: Hugh Saunders <hugh@wherenow.org>
Change-Id: I515adcad34ef76b8ea47fe90bc6572fb3aec1d2c

commit_message:
Implements subtree_as_ids and parents_as_ids

This patch implements the new ways to get the project's hierarchy:
  'subtree_as_ids': If True, returns projects IDs down the hierarchy
                    as a structured dictionay.
  'parents_as_ids': If True, returns projects IDs up the hierarchy
                    as a structured dictionay.

Change-Id: Ia3afe994893dfca059cb8361f7ab1c14e28e1ad5
Implements: blueprint hierarchical-multitenancy-improvements

commit_message:
Allowing LP specification on cmd line

Fixing bug where the LP was specified on cmd line along with
a plan file which did not LP definition was not being
recognized.

Also, removed the check for artifact name as we can just
assign the name of the app to the artifact name.

Change-Id: Id3098413bb89c52310f8a2779f4acd3b3a44fef8
Closes-Bug: #1432748

commit_message:
Remove unused oslo logging fixture

This module has been replaced by one from oslo.log and is no longer
listed in openstack-common.conf. The change that did the move to
oslo.log [1] just missed out on removing the unused files.

[1] 97d63d8745cd9b3b391ce96b94b4da263b3a053d

Change-Id: I431a0f2a34cde984a3a5ee323208b99397348a9c

revisions:
[{'number': 6, 'created': '2015-03-18 00:44:51.000000000', 'files': ['heat/scaling/template.py', 'heat/tests/test_engine_service.py', 'heat/tests/test_validate.py', 'heat/tests/utils.py', 'heat/tests/test_template.py', 'heat/engine/stack.py', 'heat/engine/resources/openstack/heat/instance_group.py', 'heat/tests/test_instance.py', 'heat/engine/template.py', 'heat/tests/test_provider_template.py', 'contrib/rackspace/rackspace/tests/test_rackspace_dns.py', 'heat/tests/test_hot.py', 'heat/tests/test_resource.py', 'heat/tests/test_metadata_refresh.py', 'heat/tests/test_function.py', 'heat/tests/test_swiftsignal.py', 'heat/tests/aws/test_waitcondition.py', 'heat/tests/test_stack.py', 'heat/tests/openstack/test_waitcondition.py', 'heat/tests/test_server.py', 'heat/tests/test_stack_update.py', 'heat/tests/test_server_tags.py', 'heat/tests/test_instance_network.py', 'heat/tests/test_sqlalchemy_api.py', 'contrib/rackspace/rackspace/tests/test_rackspace_cloud_server.py'], 'message': 'Pass the environment into the Template class and not Stack

When we moved parameters from the stack table to the template table
we did it in a "flexible" way, but this led to some difficult to
diagnose problems. So this patch totally removes "env" as an argument
to the Stack class to make absolutely sure that we are doing this
correctly. I came across these bugs when rebasing decouple-nested.

- env was not getting passed into instance group make_templates()
- template deepcopy was not working correctly (causing some problems
  when deleting backup stacks)

Change-Id: I85cfb01c68ff5a44e2ff4f6e446870efb7205933
'}]
commit_message:
Pass the environment into the Template class and not Stack

When we moved parameters from the stack table to the template table
we did it in a "flexible" way, but this led to some difficult to
diagnose problems. So this patch totally removes "env" as an argument
to the Stack class to make absolutely sure that we are doing this
correctly. I came across these bugs when rebasing decouple-nested.

- env was not getting passed into instance group make_templates()
- template deepcopy was not working correctly (causing some problems
  when deleting backup stacks)

Change-Id: I85cfb01c68ff5a44e2ff4f6e446870efb7205933

iptables firewall: add framework for iptables firewall functional test

This patch sets up framework for functional test of iptables firewall.
Tests will come as another patches.

Partially Implements: blueprint ml2-ovs-portsecurity
Change-Id: Ia0af50c8942681559bf9801515298127d30f9e34

revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2015-03-17 09:56:09.000000000', 'files': ['elements/redhat-common/bin/map-packages'], 'message': 'redhat-common: Fix MariaDB-Galera-server case

Official MariaDB repositories offer the package : MariaDB-Galera-server.
This package has been now ported within Fedora (and also RDO), the
package is now called mariadb-galera-server. Yum install being case
sensitive hence this change.

Change-Id: Icd03877f17d01708b3916578991e42eef30a69e4
'}]
commit_message:
redhat-common: Fix MariaDB-Galera-server case

Official MariaDB repositories offer the package : MariaDB-Galera-server.
This package has been now ported within Fedora (and also RDO), the
package is now called mariadb-galera-server. Yum install being case
sensitive hence this change.

Change-Id: Icd03877f17d01708b3916578991e42eef30a69e4

subject: Remove capacity check from AWS::AG update
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 4257, 'name': 'Zane Bitter', 'email': 'zbitter@redhat.com', 'username': 'zaneb'}, {'_account_id': 4715, 'name': 'Angus Salkeld', 'email': 'asalkeld@redhat.com', 'username': 'asalkeld'}, {'_account_id': 6172, 'name': 'Boris Pavlovic', 'email': 'boris@pavlovic.me', 'username': 'boris-42'}, {'_account_id': 7404, 'name': 'Ethan Lynn', 'email': 'xuanlangjian@gmail.com', 'username': 'GaryLynn'}, {'_account_id': 8289, 'name': 'huangtianhua', 'email': 'tiantian223@163.com', 'username': 'huangtianhua'}, {'_account_id': 13009, 'name': 'Peter Razumovsky', 'email': 'prazumovsky@mirantis.com', 'username': 'prazumovsky'}, {'_account_id': 14676, 'name': 'Kairat Kushaev', 'email': 'kkushaev@mirantis.com', 'username': 'kairat_kushaev'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2015-03-16 01:57:56.000000000', 'files': ['heat/tests/autoscaling/test_heat_scaling_group.py', 'heat/engine/resources/aws/autoscaling/autoscaling_group.py', 'heat_integrationtests/functional/test_heat_autoscaling.py', 'heat/tests/autoscaling/test_scaling_group.py'], 'message': "Remove capacity check from AWS::AG update

When heat is trying to update autoscaling group resource with
the same template an exception is raised because nested stack
is not in (UPDATE, COMPLETE) state. It happens because heat
doesn't change the state of nested stacks if size of Autoscaling
group has not been changed. So fix allows handle_update in
AWS::AutoscalingGroup to launch resize despite of changes
in AG capacity.

Change-Id: Ibb71f31f2ec7d1d37b995323a2474b799ea498bb
Closes-bug: #1429134
"}]
commit_message:
Remove capacity check from AWS::AG update

When heat is trying to update autoscaling group resource with
the same template an exception is raised because nested stack
is not in (UPDATE, COMPLETE) state. It happens because heat
doesn't change the state of nested stacks if size of Autoscaling
group has not been changed. So fix allows handle_update in
AWS::AutoscalingGroup to launch resize despite of changes
in AG capacity.

Change-Id: Ibb71f31f2ec7d1d37b995323a2474b799ea498bb
Closes-bug: #1429134

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-01-07 19:18:45.000000000', 'files': ['elements/neutron-openvswitch-agent/bin/init-neutron-ovs'], 'message': 'Reposition vlan type

Prior to this change, the generated YAML would insert the vlan interface
underneath (textually) the Addresses list, indented in a way that ends
up inserting it (data-structurally) as a member of the addresses list
rather than as a member of the interfaces list.

I *think* this change puts it in the expected place.

Change-Id: I1febf2a029b775e3b9d309eb86e775ec46446e96
'}]
commit_message:
Reposition vlan type

Prior to this change, the generated YAML would insert the vlan interface
underneath (textually) the Addresses list, indented in a way that ends
up inserting it (data-structurally) as a member of the addresses list
rather than as a member of the interfaces list.

I *think* this change puts it in the expected place.

Change-Id: I1febf2a029b775e3b9d309eb86e775ec46446e96

Change-Id: I58b57e01ec9bcafd7cdcfbf03149e98c3a1291ed
Partially-Implements: blueprint mtu-selection-and-advertisement
'}]
commit_message:
Add MTU selection to ML2

ML2 will check the config parameters for the MTU settings.
It will check the segment, path and physnet mtu settings.

Change-Id: I58b57e01ec9bcafd7cdcfbf03149e98c3a1291ed
Partially-Implements: blueprint mtu-selection-and-advertisement

If env is already DVR enabled, we can use command
router-update to migrate a legacy router to a
distributed router.

But current code in l3-agent will continue continue
to use LegacyRouter as router_info obj after router
update to distributed router.

Add a new method to help router to generate a new
router_info obj in dvr migrate case.

Change-Id: I7672dbc33d79ade9fbab7debe6ff7d36fd1bc661
Closes-Bug: #1428713
'}]
commit_message:
fix router update for LegacyRouter to DvrRouter

If env is already DVR enabled, we can use command
router-update to migrate a legacy router to a
distributed router.

But current code in l3-agent will continue continue
to use LegacyRouter as router_info obj after router
update to distributed router.

Add a new method to help router to generate a new
router_info obj in dvr migrate case.

Change-Id: I7672dbc33d79ade9fbab7debe6ff7d36fd1bc661
Closes-Bug: #1428713

Nova would like to use a couple of features from
oslo.utils 1.3.0 and 1.4.0. Ability to set the current

commit_message:
Bump version of oslo.utils to 1.4.0

Nova would like to use a couple of features from
oslo.utils 1.3.0 and 1.4.0. Ability to set the current
working directory during processutils.execute and
ability to set a custom logger when an exception is
dropped.

Change-Id: I488757a3e8ebc15dd2b58c82e8e1579829a096f9

Provide hooks for FWaaS repo functional gate

This provides the needed hook files so that functional tests
can be run in the neutron-fwaas repo.

A placeholder test case is added, to actually exercise the
gate. In a separate commit, real test cases will be added.

Change-Id: Iaad6d5d42a103cbaabbf32b7371254cefc4578fb

commit_message:
Fixes tests on invalid payload secret creation and adds new exception

Adding a new exception to cover the case of a payload being set
to a list or int. Moved the zero case to the no payload tests as well.
Functional test now verifies new exception is raised with bad types.

Change-Id: Id026fd7a2004c6c30502a30bca96b6116d4bc9cf

commit_message:
Use session with neutronclient

Use the standard session and auth plugin helpers from keystoneclient to
standardize the options available for talking to neutron. This will
allow improvements such as using keystone v3 authentication for the
neutron user.

DocImpact: Deprecating the existing auth parameters in favour of
keystoneclient's session and auth plugin loading parameters.

Closes-Bug: #1424462
Change-Id: I7b3b825737dde333c8d88019d814304cbefdbfc7

commit_message:
Fix spec tests in stable/juno branch

The change 152595 and 159261 must be merged together because their are
inter-dependent…

This patch set the `concat_basedir` default for spec tests and pin
rspec-puppet to 1.0.1 because the new version broke puppet-openstack
unit tests (undefined method `resource')

Conflicts:
	spec/spec_helper.rb

Co-Authored-By: Lukas Bezdicka <lbezdick@redhat.com>
Change-Id: I4b686e5ebe3d3641b95669071a7b4dd678f19d11

commit_message:
Bump up debtcollector to 0.3

TaskFlow would like to use the new functionality
extracted from itself -> debtcollector so that TaskFlow
can remove the duplicated code. Having this version
available would make this possible to happen.

Change-Id: I120dac06fbe5d23e99130568e144c4b664e61b66

Currently, several of the volumes apis depend on callers to pass
service_type='volume' as a parameter when creating a client object,
to route correctly. The problem is, it makes it impossible for
callers to work with both the compute and volume endpoints at the
same time. They can either work with compute and have volumes.* calls
return 404, or they can work with volume and have servers.* images.*
flavors.* calls return 404.

The CLI sets service_type='volume' for client objects for the
following commands via a decorator:

volume-list

volume-snapshot-list

Closes-Bug: #1431154

Change-Id: I11b48ac14fa4c64d8aae528552ec5b363be384c5
"}]
commit_message:
Ensure the use of volume endpoint in volumes apis

Currently, several of the volumes apis depend on callers to pass
service_type='volume' as a parameter when creating a client object,
to route correctly. The problem is, it makes it impossible for
callers to work with both the compute and volume endpoints at the
same time. They can either work with compute and have volumes.* calls
return 404, or they can work with volume and have servers.* images.*
flavors.* calls return 404.

The CLI sets service_type='volume' for client objects for the
following commands via a decorator:

volume-list
volume-show
volume-create
volume-delete
volume-snapshot-list
volume-snapshot-show
volume-snapshot-create
volume-snapshot-delete
volume-type-list
volume-type-create
volume-type-delete

With this change, the service_type 'volume' is set in the api,
so the decorators on the shell commands are no longer needed.

Closes-Bug: #1431154

Change-Id: I11b48ac14fa4c64d8aae528552ec5b363be384c5

commit_message:
Ignore unknown groups in lists for Federation

Ignore groups that don't match ones in the backend.
For Federation this will be the norm;
groups may pass the blacklist but Keystone doesn't know about them.
Otherwise, any in additional groups sent by the external IdP will
break the mapping

Change-Id: Ic1729da8606f50458db2fd163cd90bc5d89e24fa
Closes-Bug: 1429334

commit_message:
Remove redundant calls to clear_isolated_creds

clear_isolated_creds is executed as part of the class teardown
defined in test.py. Test classes and base classes do not need
to invoke it anymore, so removing any redundant invocation.

Change-Id: I5a9ac66a6c5d41bf0274d022e7b6b4a1932c77df
Partially-implements: bp/resource-cleanup

revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2015-03-17 19:45:52.000000000', 'files': ['manifests/api.pp', 'spec/classes/glance_api_spec.rb'], 'message': "api: change default pipeline

Setting up cache requires ops to be aware of how cache works in Glance
and the fact they'll need more space on disk. It can be dangerous when
using shared storage (Ceph for example).

This patch aims to default to 'keystone' without cachemanagement
anymore.

This is not backward compatible, so if the deployer is not overriding
this parameter, Glance API won't manage the cache anymore.

Change-Id: Ibac35501658b2ba79081cbc7a53245d4a4eb7839
"}]
commit_message:
api: change default pipeline

Setting up cache requires ops to be aware of how cache works in Glance
and the fact they'll need more space on disk. It can be dangerous when
using shared storage (Ceph for example).

This patch aims to default to 'keystone' without cachemanagement
anymore.

This is not backward compatible, so if the deployer is not overriding
this parameter, Glance API won't manage the cache anymore.

Change-Id: Ibac35501658b2ba79081cbc7a53245d4a4eb7839

commit_message:
Remove usage of remotable context parameter in agent, aggregate

This removes the use of the context parameter in remotable methods
in these objects. This is a precursor to actually removing the
context from the call, but we need to remove dependence on the
argument first. Remotable methods should be using the bundled object
context.

Related to blueprint kilo-objects

Change-Id: Iad5093622337077418a8ef94c9867dfd7a7fdf64

subject: Extract BaseAuth out of Auth Plugin
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 2218, 'name': 'Adam Young', 'email': 'adam@younglogic.com', 'username': 'ayoung'}, {'_account_id': 7191, 'name': 'Jamie Lennox', 'email': 'jamielennox@gmail.com', 'username': 'jamielennox'}, {'_account_id': 8978, 'name': 'Marek Denis', 'email': 'marek.denis+openstack@gmail.com', 'username': 'marek-denis'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2015-03-16 22:54:36.000000000', 'files': ['keystoneclient/auth/identity/v3/__init__.py', 'keystoneclient/auth/identity/v3/base.py'], 'message': 'Extract BaseAuth out of Auth Plugin

The basic Auth plugin for v3 tokens makes the assumption that you need
to pass in some AuthMethod objects. This works well for most auth types
where you want the plugin to construct the auth request for you.

In the case of federation though we want to be able to have a rescoping
plugin that will return an auth_ref and not take any auth_methods as
arguments.

Extract the most basic part of the Auth plugin into BaseAuth class that
Auth and federation plugins can both inherit from.

Change-Id: Ia8c8c614b8eb51170346ff5b1e20a1e7ebbb47de
'}]
commit_message:
Extract BaseAuth out of Auth Plugin

The basic Auth plugin for v3 tokens makes the assumption that you need
to pass in some AuthMethod objects. This works well for most auth types
where you want the plugin to construct the auth request for you.

In the case of federation though we want to be able to have a rescoping
plugin that will return an auth_ref and not take any auth_methods as
arguments.

Extract the most basic part of the Auth plugin into BaseAuth class that
Auth and federation plugins can both inherit from.

Change-Id: Ia8c8c614b8eb51170346ff5b1e20a1e7ebbb47de

commit_message:
Split v3 authentication file into module

The V3 authentication plugins file contained the existing plugins as
well as the base class. As we look to add new plugins it is simpler if
we break this file up.

Change-Id: I42b222a2012ea10491450d6b91c2008178dc7671

commit_message:
Fixed transcluded content not updating in action list

The transcluded content passed to <action> was not updating
since it was using the directive's isolated scope. Fixed this
by using <ng-transclude> in action templates instead.

Change-Id: I8304835894de557adf329a4c883bc7330a19eec9
Closes-Bug: #1432790

commit_message:
Add gabbi tests for resources

These test for appopriate HTTP behavior. Two different files are
used: one without any resources established by fixture and one which
uses the SampleDataFixture to make sure there is one resource.

Future gabbi tests for resources should explore authorization
handling (RBAC) and more complex query scenarios (with larger data
sets).

Change-Id: I95b4ed684f663912c29da3d48102631f4d0dd4df

subject: Check for redirection in image-download
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 6549, 'name': 'Zhi Yan Liu', 'email': 'lzy.dev@gmail.com', 'username': 'lzy-dev'}, {'_account_id': 12299, 'name': 'Paweł Koniszewski', 'email': 'pawel.koniszewski@gmail.com', 'username': 'pawel.koniszewski'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-08-08 19:08:02.000000000', 'files': ['glanceclient/v1/shell.py', 'glanceclient/v2/shell.py'], 'message': 'Check for redirection in image-download

Glace image-download outputs the image data on stdout
if no file is specified which results in a lot of
gibberish being printed to the console. The command
should only output the image if it is being redirected
or if is being saved on to a file to avoid the gibberish
from being printed.

Change-Id: Ia09aaa40dc1ae28dbc0249fc103ed9acdc8b7c2a
Closes-bug: #1314705
'}]
commit_message:
Check for redirection in image-download

Glace image-download outputs the image data on stdout
if no file is specified which results in a lot of
gibberish being printed to the console. The command
should only output the image if it is being redirected
or if is being saved on to a file to avoid the gibberish
from being printed.

Change-Id: Ia09aaa40dc1ae28dbc0249fc103ed9acdc8b7c2a
Closes-bug: #1314705

Adding new ACL tables and migration scripts.
Added new creator_id support in secret, container and order entity.
Added GET/POST/PUT/DELETE support for SecretACL operations.
Added GET/POST/PUT/DELETE support for ContainerACL operations.
Added ACL based policy support for a secret or container 'read' operation.
Added support for allowing secret and container's creator to perform 'get' call.
Fixed existing tests related to changes in this patch.
Added unit tests for models, repositories, acls controller and policy changes.

Changed logic around secret or container project to match token's project.
Now it uses policy rule instead of using it in db lookup critieria.

Updated alembic migration till 03/05/2015 version.

Change-Id: I774bf061c5b77d6a2042a2cb16c329ca2dd65f82
Implements: blueprint add-per-secret-policy
"}]
commit_message:
Adding per secret ACL support

Adding new ACL tables and migration scripts.
Added new creator_id support in secret, container and order entity.
Added GET/POST/PUT/DELETE support for SecretACL operations.
Added GET/POST/PUT/DELETE support for ContainerACL operations.
Added ACL based policy support for a secret or container 'read' operation.
Added support for allowing secret and container's creator to perform 'get' call.
Fixed existing tests related to changes in this patch.
Added unit tests for models, repositories, acls controller and policy changes.

Changed logic around secret or container project to match token's project.
Now it uses policy rule instead of using it in db lookup critieria.

Updated alembic migration till 03/05/2015 version.

Change-Id: I774bf061c5b77d6a2042a2cb16c329ca2dd65f82
Implements: blueprint add-per-secret-policy

commit_message:
Add an integration guide to Kolla

The best part about Kolla is using it!  In order to do that, we need to
instruct our consumers how it should be consumed.  This guide is a start
at that effort, but more work is needed.

Implements Blueprint: integration-guide

Change-Id: I64a3264a488f6dc934696307cd567e09d4817431

commit_message:
L23network -- set of fixes:

* Change conditions for prevent unnided execution chains of code.
* Prevent from multiple base interface autocreation for subinterface.
* Change order when transformation for base interface comes after
  transformation for subinterface.
* fix "empty bond can't be added to bridge"

Fuel-CI: disable
Blueprint: refactor-l23-linux-bridges
Change-Id: Ib76fb7ef146416cad0d88fb6526a7ec7043fcd0b

revisions:
[{'number': 9, 'created': '2015-03-17 18:09:12.000000000', 'files': ['functionaltests/api/v1/functional/test_secrets.py'], 'message': 'Refactor secrets functional tests for readability

Updates to secrets functional tests to make them more readable
and understandable:

-- make copies of default data to avoid corruption when tests
are run in parallel

-- rename tests to be more descriptive

-- changed test model fields to direct assignments rather than
using override_values.

-- using explicit keyword args for "old way" secret payload GETs.

Change-Id: Idde3b144a95ff3341db80e521217cb2d9a899311
'}]
commit_message:
Refactor secrets functional tests for readability

Updates to secrets functional tests to make them more readable
and understandable:

-- make copies of default data to avoid corruption when tests
are run in parallel

-- rename tests to be more descriptive

-- changed test model fields to direct assignments rather than
using override_values.

-- using explicit keyword args for "old way" secret payload GETs.

Change-Id: Idde3b144a95ff3341db80e521217cb2d9a899311

revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2015-03-16 20:41:03.000000000', 'files': ['barbican/api/controllers/secrets.py', 'doc/source/api.rst'], 'message': 'Deprecate old secret decrypt path both in code and docs

Since the introduction of appending of 'payload' to the path to
decrypt a secret was merged both in the server and the client. Only
thing missing was to change that in the documentation and to issue a
deprecation warning in the code. This CR implements that.

Note that this only issues a log warning in the server, and doesn't
disable the decryption of message through the "old way".

Change-Id: I64f371732747323c6f89bc26143ca2765c5ea237
'}]
commit_message:
Deprecate old secret decrypt path both in code and docs

Since the introduction of appending of 'payload' to the path to
decrypt a secret was merged both in the server and the client. Only
thing missing was to change that in the documentation and to issue a
deprecation warning in the code. This CR implements that.

Note that this only issues a log warning in the server, and doesn't
disable the decryption of message through the "old way".

Change-Id: I64f371732747323c6f89bc26143ca2765c5ea237

Added ACL based policy support for a secret or container 'read' operation.
Added support for allowing secret and container's creator to perform 'get'

Added unit tests for policy changes.

Changed logic around secret or container project to match token's project.

commit_message:
Adding per secret ACL support with policy layer changes (Part 3)

Added ACL based policy support for a secret or container 'read' operation.
Added support for allowing secret and container's creator to perform 'get'
call.
Added unit tests for policy changes.

Changed logic around secret or container project to match token's project.
Now it uses policy rule instead of using it in db lookup critieria.

Change-Id: Ia5c9a51af6fb4b78ebc48442ebce3de1ab243fe9

[{'number': 15, 'created': '2015-03-17 16:26:49.000000000', 'files': ['deployment/puppet/cobbler/manifests/server.pp', 'deployment/puppet/cobbler/templates/httpd_ssl.conf.erb', 'deployment/puppet/cobbler/templates/httpd_nailgun.conf.erb', 'deployment/puppet/nailgun/manifests/cobbler.pp', 'deployment/puppet/cobbler/templates/httpd.conf.erb'], 'message': 'Disable weak ssl ciphers in httpd
Disable HTTP Trace method

Nessus security scanner has detected a
various vulnerabilities related to improper
SSL/TLS configuration on the Fuel node.

Vulnerabilities reported by Nessus:
78479 - SSLv3 Padding Oracle On Downgraded
        Legacy Encryption Vulnerability (POODLE)
42873 - SSL Medium Strength Cipher Suites Supported
58751 - SSL/TLS Protocol Initialization Vector
        Implementation Information Disclosure
        Vulnerability
11213 - HTTP TRACE / TRACK Methods Allowed

Fix linting

Change-Id: I8dd4f178835dbebbc0dfd70aefe7002cae0f545f
Closes-Bug: 1408590
Signed-off-by: Sergii Golovatiuk <sgolovatiuk@mirantis.com>
'}]
commit_message:
Disable weak ssl ciphers in httpd
Disable HTTP Trace method

Nessus security scanner has detected a
various vulnerabilities related to improper
SSL/TLS configuration on the Fuel node.

Vulnerabilities reported by Nessus:
78479 - SSLv3 Padding Oracle On Downgraded
        Legacy Encryption Vulnerability (POODLE)
42873 - SSL Medium Strength Cipher Suites Supported
58751 - SSL/TLS Protocol Initialization Vector
        Implementation Information Disclosure
        Vulnerability
11213 - HTTP TRACE / TRACK Methods Allowed

Fix linting

Change-Id: I8dd4f178835dbebbc0dfd70aefe7002cae0f545f
Closes-Bug: 1408590
Signed-off-by: Sergii Golovatiuk <sgolovatiuk@mirantis.com>

commit_message:
If providers exist in neutron.conf, don't look in services conf

Certain tests still put providers into neutron.conf, and upgrade scenarios
will have more correct providers in neutron.conf than the new locations.
If we find providers in neutron.conf, use them in favor of the
split config files during the transition.

Closes-Bug: 1422895
Change-Id: I731f7c80c2df78fa521a5140e450972119f4a105

Applications could replace the default log levels but not extend
them.

Applications should be able to extend the default log levels since
an application typically just wants to add the libraries that it
uses beyond what the other applications use.

Closes-Bug: 1432369
Change-Id: Iae05ddca8bd38e44bf20a9d6ab22259ce07d8bc4
'}]
commit_message:
Allow extending default log levels

Applications could replace the default log levels but not extend
them.

Applications should be able to extend the default log levels since
an application typically just wants to add the libraries that it
uses beyond what the other applications use.

Closes-Bug: 1432369
Change-Id: Iae05ddca8bd38e44bf20a9d6ab22259ce07d8bc4

revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2015-02-17 07:12:55.000000000', 'files': ['specs/no-downward-sql-migration.rst'], 'message': 'Cross-Project spec to eliminate SQL Schema Downgrades

This proposes the cross-project spec to eliminate SQL Schema Downgrades
in OpenStack. This is based upon the conversations had on both the
dev and operator mailing lists. In short, SQL Schema Downgrades do not
have a clear use-case where a restore to known-good point would not both
be more appropriate and desired (due to data inconsistency, integrity,
etc).

Change-Id: I622f89fe63327d44f9b229d3bd9e76e15acbaa7a
'}]
commit_message:
Cross-Project spec to eliminate SQL Schema Downgrades

This proposes the cross-project spec to eliminate SQL Schema Downgrades
in OpenStack. This is based upon the conversations had on both the
dev and operator mailing lists. In short, SQL Schema Downgrades do not
have a clear use-case where a restore to known-good point would not both
be more appropriate and desired (due to data inconsistency, integrity,
etc).

Change-Id: I622f89fe63327d44f9b229d3bd9e76e15acbaa7a

commit_message:
Allow updates to export locations

Update init_host() method of share manager to allow
driver return a list of export locations via ensure_share() method.
Save export locations to the database in exact same order in which
driver provides it.

Partially implements bp multiple-export-locations

Change-Id: If4291faa6aa2216703642a8e0279c1dcb064d9cb

commit_message:
Remove usage of remotable context parameter in bandwidth, block_device

This removes the use of the context parameter in remotable methods
in these objects. This is a precursor to actually removing the
context from the call, but we need to remove dependence on the
argument first. Remotable methods should be using the bundled object
context.

Related to blueprint kilo-objects

Change-Id: I6d4ccef9a2c59a6a082b4ce4eed03ae959eb0983

commit_message:
Add memory.resident libvirt meter for Ceilometer

The 'memory.resident' metric will expose the
physical hosts view of the amount of host memory that is actually used to
run the VM process

DocImpact: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/164724

Change-Id: I9f2ad784479f234679e1145efd96d9d707dd19d0
Implements: blueprint memory-resident

commit_message:
Angular Nova Ext & Svc Catalog Utility Options

This patch is to explore different angular caching
and utility options.  Currently the services don't provide much
in the way of handling caching or utility methods.

This patch is intended for there to be a series of patchsets
to compare ideas.  Current patch sets to compare:

 - Patch Set 1

Change-Id: Ib58166f1511996d3c3c834ef082eeef118197a2c

commit_message:
Removed gate check output filter (icehouse)

This commit removes the gate check script output filter. This is being
removed because the filter is using awk and awk will always return 0
even if the command within the pipe fails.

Change-Id: Ie6463f4eab2c866ad941b4b9fd581722870dd5c2
Closes-Bug: #1432295

subject: use 'id' instead of 'name' for locating default domain
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 6488, 'name': 'Clint Byrum', 'email': 'clint@fewbar.com', 'username': 'clint-fewbar'}, {'_account_id': 6796, 'name': 'Giulio Fidente', 'email': 'gfidente@redhat.com', 'username': 'gfidente'}, {'_account_id': 7144, 'name': 'James Slagle', 'email': 'jslagle@redhat.com', 'username': 'slagle'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-03-03 18:37:13.000000000', 'files': ['os_cloud_config/tests/test_keystone.py', 'os_cloud_config/keystone.py'], 'message': "use 'id' instead of 'name' for locating default domain

A fresh Keystone install creates a domain with id == 'default' and name
== 'Default'. This was causing `_grant_admin_user_roles` to fail because
it was looking for:

    default_domain = keystone_v3.domains.list(name='default')[0]

This would cause init-keystone to fail with:

    IndexError: list index out of range

This modifies the function to use the `id` attribute instead.

Change-Id: Ia6372e561a0bc8308f5f14d8c820f696b95041a4
Closes-bug: #1427760
"}]
commit_message:
use 'id' instead of 'name' for locating default domain

A fresh Keystone install creates a domain with id == 'default' and name
== 'Default'. This was causing `_grant_admin_user_roles` to fail because
it was looking for:

    default_domain = keystone_v3.domains.list(name='default')[0]

This would cause init-keystone to fail with:

    IndexError: list index out of range

This modifies the function to use the `id` attribute instead.

Change-Id: Ia6372e561a0bc8308f5f14d8c820f696b95041a4
Closes-bug: #1427760

[{'number': 13, 'created': '2015-03-14 15:47:08.000000000', 'files': ['manilaclient/v1/shares.py', 'manilaclient/tests/unit/v1/fakes.py', 'manilaclient/tests/unit/v1/test_shell.py', 'manilaclient/tests/unit/v1/test_shares.py', 'manilaclient/v1/shell.py'], 'message': 'Add basic manage/unmanage share functionality

Manage share functionality adds possibility to add existing
shares to manila. On other hand unmanage functionality adds
possibility to remove share from manila, but without physical
removal from share backend.

- Add manage() and unmanage() methods to share manager
- Add manage and unmanage shell commands

Change-Id: I7f8c4cbea6b699c468a8e85104cbe4111f796eb1

commit_message:
Add basic manage/unmanage share functionality

Manage share functionality adds possibility to add existing
shares to manila. On other hand unmanage functionality adds
possibility to remove share from manila, but without physical
removal from share backend.

- Add manage() and unmanage() methods to share manager
- Add manage and unmanage shell commands
- Add appropriate unit tests.

Partially implements bp manage-shares

Change-Id: I7f8c4cbea6b699c468a8e85104cbe4111f796eb1

commit_message:
Policy Enforcement Point

As a part of policy guided fulfillment we need to
enforce policy rules from global context on Murano
environment deployment. If enforcement fails,
then deployment fails.

Incorporating changes based on moving murano data schema spec into
Congress specs.

republished review https://review.openstack.org/#/c/140395/ in order to
change owner

Change-Id: I0bf71788e189344fdb4a3dba50c32273b4c6e475

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-03-15 08:51:55.000000000', 'files': ['lib/glance'], 'message': 'Fix Traceback exceptions in g-api and g-reg

The log_context format specified in glance-api and glance-reistry
are causing tracebacks.  This fix changes the
project_id and user_id to tenant and user which are supported
in oslo-context.  This is the format used by other projects

Change-Id: Ifbf268e9765039a0085c9af930dabf8a5cc681b8
Closes-Bug: #1431784
'}]
commit_message:
Fix Traceback exceptions in g-api and g-reg

The log_context format specified in glance-api and glance-reistry
are causing tracebacks.  This fix changes the
project_id and user_id to tenant and user which are supported
in oslo-context.  This is the format used by other projects

Change-Id: Ifbf268e9765039a0085c9af930dabf8a5cc681b8
Closes-Bug: #1431784

commit_message:
Migration of swift sections to RST

DocBook to RST conversion of following sections:
- create containers
- manage access
- manage objects
- environment vars
- object versions
- serialized response formats
- large lists
- hierarchical folders
- discoverability
- large objects
- archive auto extract
- bulk delete
- static websites

Change-Id: Ia4d7e49477f6e8ceba9fc50c93eb66f8feda7826

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-02-27 11:27:51.000000000', 'files': ['cinder/volume/drivers/smbfs.py', 'cinder/tests/test_smbfs.py'], 'message': 'SMBFS: Fix retrieving the volume path and format

The SMBFS drivers use the image format in order to construct the
according image path, as some image formats require having the
proper extension.

The format is either retrieved using qemu-img if the image exists,
either via extra specs or config options otherwise.

The issue is that when searching for local images, the extension is
not used, falling back to extra specs, which can cause lazy load
errors or config options, which might change.

This issue occurs when vhd/x images are used. The fix consists in
simply using the possible extensions when trying to find existing
images.

Change-Id: I85ef7862489eb434a00cd897f5344bb89b7de858
Closes-bug: #1425124
'}]
commit_message:
SMBFS: Fix retrieving the volume path and format

The SMBFS drivers use the image format in order to construct the
according image path, as some image formats require having the
proper extension.

The format is either retrieved using qemu-img if the image exists,
either via extra specs or config options otherwise.

The issue is that when searching for local images, the extension is
not used, falling back to extra specs, which can cause lazy load
errors or config options, which might change.

This issue occurs when vhd/x images are used. The fix consists in
simply using the possible extensions when trying to find existing
images.

Change-Id: I85ef7862489eb434a00cd897f5344bb89b7de858
Closes-bug: #1425124

commit_message:
Move V2 sample files to respective directory

Some sample files like server, images etc are kept under api_samples/
directory.
As plan is to create clean directory structure for sample files for
V2, V2.1 and microversion, moving these sample files to respective directory
will help to achieve that.

Change-Id: I284d035f6fadb26a94bcb3586f4a8c72942ee423

commit_message:
V2 tests -Reuse server post req/resp sample file

There are lot of duplicate sample files for server POST req/resp
in functional tests.

This patch reuse the server post req/resp sample file for V2
functional tests.

Change-Id: I4fc5771af9407b9e75cf07682ee1706935a87709

commit_message:
V2.1 tests - Reuse server post req/resp sample file

There are lot of duplicate sample files for server POST req/resp
in functional tests.

This patch reuse the server post req/resp sample file for V2.1
functional tests.

Change-Id: I5da924b78780eae64a40ee39ee4fbe1e5b8c3b1f

commit_message:
Handles exception when unsupported virt-type given

When a wrong virt type is configured in nova configuration files
there is no mechaninsm to tell to the user about the unsupported
virt type.  This fix throws an unsupported virt type expection
to the user if a wrong virt type is configured in the configs.

Change-Id: I794a7c37d7a6224235a7fcb649f7db418687a794
Closes-Bug: #1425571

commit_message:
Virt: update fake driver to use UUID as lookup key

Instances that are tracked by the fake driver are now stored with
the UUID as the key and not the instance name. The reason is that the
instance name need not be unique.

TrivialFix

Change-Id: I32f70ea6d9255e4eaafbf1720930e87dea2e19d9

commit_message:
compute: don't trace on InstanceNotFound in reverts_task_state

Commit c43f2b0d708f0f4b37850d2917c0abcc13b8789b added logging when
_instance_update fails in reverts_task_state but we shouldn't log
InstanceNotFound since it's a normal (expected) error when we're
deleting an instance shortly after it fails to build.

Closes-Bug: #1431404

Change-Id: Iec3dfaa16b472bc88d56d9c6680a7c247f2f50bd

revisions:
[{'number': 8, 'created': '2015-03-16 15:16:04.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/unit/compute/test_compute.py', 'nova/compute/manager.py'], 'message': 'Handle exception when doing detach_interface

Currently, in compute api, detach_interface will delete neutron port
first then calls hypervisor driver to do detach_interface on the guest.
If the driver does detach_interface failed, in case of the driver raise
an exception.InterfaceDetachFailed or other NovaExceptions, there is no
handler for them.
Besides this is an asyn rpc call, so nova-api will not notice these
exceptions. End user will find the port has been deleted in neutron side,
but still can see this port on guest, this is inconsistent.

This patch moves delete port in neturon side after hypervisor finished
detach_interface successfully, if it catch NovaException,
gives a log warning, and keep this port in neutron.

Change-Id: Ie376c211093f63a4b3f3837267c74502bd34a192
Closes-Bug: #1432465
'}]
commit_message:
Handle exception when doing detach_interface

Currently, in compute api, detach_interface will delete neutron port
first then calls hypervisor driver to do detach_interface on the guest.
If the driver does detach_interface failed, in case of the driver raise
an exception.InterfaceDetachFailed or other NovaExceptions, there is no
handler for them.
Besides this is an asyn rpc call, so nova-api will not notice these
exceptions. End user will find the port has been deleted in neutron side,
but still can see this port on guest, this is inconsistent.

This patch moves delete port in neturon side after hypervisor finished
detach_interface successfully, if it catch NovaException,
gives a log warning, and keep this port in neutron.

Change-Id: Ie376c211093f63a4b3f3837267c74502bd34a192
Closes-Bug: #1432465

Some disk partitions do not have associated I/O metrics.  This
was causing an exception when trying to retrieve them. If the
partition doesn't have I/O metrics, just skip it. Also, fixed

Change-Id: Ie984e1fe589f9356b4009d613fe7d1e0f4e18439

commit_message:
Fixing issue with disk metrics

Some disk partitions do not have associated I/O metrics.  This
was causing an exception when trying to retrieve them. If the
partition doesn't have I/O metrics, just skip it. Also, fixed
an issue where the dimensions were not getting updated correctly.

Change-Id: Ie984e1fe589f9356b4009d613fe7d1e0f4e18439

commit_message:
Stop using exception.message

This usage has been deprecated since Python 2.6 and generates a warning
when running the code. Let's fix that in a way it is compatible for all
Python versions.

Change-Id: Ife404544f731ff098f4ce205da11bc452ed4d355

commit_message:
Hyper-V: Sets *DataRoot paths for instances

Sets the path for the instance's ConfigurationDataRoot,
LogDataRoot, SnapshotDataRoot, SuspendDataRoot and
SwapFileDataRoot to the instance's location.

Change-Id: Ifc7824f559a09fb97b3437f11ef6a71169bf294c
Closes-Bug: #1430239

commit_message:
Prevent deletion of nodes which have running OSD processes

Node deletion will fail if a node with the ceph-osd role still
has PGs placed on any of its OSDs. Removing too many OSDs can result in
data loss. The end-user will be required to manually remove
those OSDs from the cluster and allow it to rebalance to ensure
no data is lost when deleting these nodes as described here:
http://ceph.com/docs/master/rados/operations/add-or-rm-osds/#removing-osds-manual

DocImpact
Change-Id: I41173a83a3268455148652680a534e47296af319
Closes-bug: #1424060

commit_message:
NFS based driver for Quobyte file storage system

Based on the nfs-ganesha approach we're adding a Quobyte file storage driver
using the Quobyte FSAL implementation. This is extended by calls to
the QB Backend API for volume creation/deletion while nfs-ganesha is used
to provide NFS access for the nova guests.

blueprint: quobyte-manila-driver

DocImpact: Adds configs for Quobyte Manila driver: quobyte_api_url,
quobyte_api_ca, quobyte_delete_shares, quobyte_api_username,
quobyte_api_password, quobyte_volume_configuration,
quobyte_default_volume_user, quobyte_default_volume_group
(Additional info on these config params can be found at
manila/share/drivers/quobyte/quobyte.py)

Change-Id: I935cb1f2321fe288d997533387aff01938d1f3d0

commit_message:
Change ODL_BOOT_WAIT to 30 seconds

This should give enough time for ODL to come up on most systems.

Change-Id: If5194682bc9d8a6ee003daa542cb0fad7e192725

commit_message:
Adds FWaaS service plugin for Cisco CSR1kv

Support for Cisco CSR1kv Firewall:
Add API extensions and associated db for insertion of FW service
on Cisco CSR1kv router. There are no changes to the reference implementation
model for FWaaS rules and policies.

Change-Id: I830c78d1b538da632e3dfd7d78ff82a81d534208
Implements: blueprint fwaas-cisco

commit_message:
Remove db layer hard-code permission checks for task_log_begin/end_task

This patches remove the hard-code permission checks for db call
task_log_begin/end_task. And there isn't any REST API entrance for
this two db calls, so we can remove them directly.

Partially implements bp v3-api-policy

Change-Id: I074da55b207ab1951d3b8b5e0bd578509992462f

subject: Convert leftover unconditional set -x to DIB_DEBUG_TRACE
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 6488, 'name': 'Clint Byrum', 'email': 'clint@fewbar.com', 'username': 'clint-fewbar'}, {'_account_id': 6796, 'name': 'Giulio Fidente', 'email': 'gfidente@redhat.com', 'username': 'gfidente'}, {'_account_id': 6928, 'name': 'Ben Nemec', 'email': 'openstack@nemebean.com', 'username': 'bnemec'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-03-11 14:05:05.000000000', 'files': ['elements/debian/root.d/08-debootstrap', 'elements/centos-minimal/root.d/08-rinse', 'elements/ubuntu-minimal/root.d/08-debootstrap-ubuntu'], 'message': 'Convert leftover unconditional set -x to DIB_DEBUG_TRACE

Commit 36b59c001c1643217449646b371df46d2cb11b91 introduces
DIB_DEBUG_TRACE, to be checked in element scripts for enabling tracing.

In the aforementioned conversion, few scripts were left with
unconditional "set -x" calls: remove them, changing the default value
for unset DIB_DEBUG_TRACE from 0 to 1, to retain their older behaviour
(as it was done in 36b59c001c1643217449646b371df46d2cb11b91 too).

Change-Id: I3d1a9290021bf63de7d4e7752e809852e784ac8b
'}]
commit_message:
Convert leftover unconditional set -x to DIB_DEBUG_TRACE

Commit 36b59c001c1643217449646b371df46d2cb11b91 introduces
DIB_DEBUG_TRACE, to be checked in element scripts for enabling tracing.

In the aforementioned conversion, few scripts were left with
unconditional "set -x" calls: remove them, changing the default value
for unset DIB_DEBUG_TRACE from 0 to 1, to retain their older behaviour
(as it was done in 36b59c001c1643217449646b371df46d2cb11b91 too).

Change-Id: I3d1a9290021bf63de7d4e7752e809852e784ac8b

commit_message:
Adding tempest_roles when auth_version is v3

With identity v3 the _member_ role is not added on the projects
automatically for the user when it's created.

Setting _member_ to tempest_roles so that tempest adds the role.

Change-Id: Iaae9286ecc6f019d36261a5c450068a650e24a28

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-03-16 14:49:41.000000000', 'files': ['lib/nova', 'lib/keystone', 'lib/rpc_backend', 'lib/trove', 'stack.sh'], 'message': "Take an optional rabbit user name as input

Newer versions of rabbitmq (3.3 and later) do not allow the 'guest'
user to access on non-local interfaces.

- Invoked config scripts using that variable

Adopted from:
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/107779/

Backported to stable/icehouse from:

	lib/rpc_backend
	lib/trove

Closes-Bug: #1343354
Co-Authored-By: Scott Moser <smoser@ubuntu.com>

commit_message:
Take an optional rabbit user name as input

Newer versions of rabbitmq (3.3 and later) do not allow the 'guest'
user to access on non-local interfaces.

- Added a new config RABBIT_USERID which defaults to stackrabbit
- Invoked config scripts using that variable

Adopted from:
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/107779/

Backported to stable/icehouse from:
d5b74c688f Take an optional rabbit user name as input
https://review.openstack.org/141156

Conflicts:
	lib/keystone
	lib/rpc_backend
	lib/trove

Change-Id: I034f3eda09827451b5437c430049aa2ebfd67b2e
Closes-Bug: #1343354
Co-Authored-By: Scott Moser <smoser@ubuntu.com>

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-02-18 13:03:40.000000000', 'files': ['nova/virt/hyperv/vmops.py', 'nova/tests/virt/hyperv/test_hypervapi.py'], 'message': "Fixes Hyper-V configdrive network injection issue

The Hyper-V driver is not properly handling static IP configuration
injection when flat_injected is true and networks don't have DHCP
enabled. This commit fixes the issue.

        nova/virt/hyperv/vmops.py

Change-Id: Ie54f1c892f1db53b1807661acacbae5bd45c0777

commit_message:
Fixes Hyper-V configdrive network injection issue

The Hyper-V driver is not properly handling static IP configuration
injection when flat_injected is true and networks don't have DHCP
enabled. This commit fixes the issue.

Conflicts:
        nova/virt/hyperv/vmops.py

Change-Id: Ie54f1c892f1db53b1807661acacbae5bd45c0777
Closes-Bug: #1400069
(cherry-pick from commit 01cff74dfe377dcd51527ab38b0a078f0c4b61a3)

commit_message:
Create nova-zvm-virt-driver project on StackForge

This project implements nova virtulization driver for zVM.

Background:
There's an existing project - zvm-driver on StackForge, which contains
both nova-zvm-virt-driver and neutron-zvm-plugin. In order to make it
easier to develop, maintain and setting up CI system on StackForge,
we plan to create new projects on StackForge for each
nova-zvm-virt-driver and neutron-zvm-plugin, then obsolete project
zvm-driver.

Change-Id: I481d583cf72888c9ceb96aedd0f25a5532f7f704

commit_message:
Remove unused file locks on c-vol service startup

This commit adds cinder.utils.cleanup_lock_files method which is
calling lockutils.remove_external_lock_file for each file in Cinder's
file lock directory. The function is executed in VolumeManager's
init_host method. This should clean up unused lock files on c-vol
service startup.

Change-Id: Ida411ea12c40b03de21ae2a31e1cc0db38e0fbc9
Closes-Bug: 1432387

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-03-17 14:12:27.000000000', 'files': ['cinder/tests/brick/test_brick_connector.py', 'etc/cinder/rootwrap.d/volume.filters', 'cinder/tests/test_utils.py', 'cinder/volume/driver.py', 'cinder/brick/initiator/connector.py', 'cinder/volume/iscsi.py', 'cinder/tests/test_volume.py', 'cinder/utils.py', 'cinder/tests/test_coraid.py'], 'message': 'Enhance iSCSI multipath support

Currently, nova-compute and brick support multipath for iSCSI volume
data path. It depends on response to targets discovery of the main
iSCSI portal, expecting multiple portal addresses to be contained.

However, some arrays only respond to discovery with a single portal
address, even if secondary portals are available. In this case,
the connector cannot know secondary portals and corresponding
iSCSI target IQN, so cannot establish multiple sessions for
the target(s). To enable the connector to login to secondary portals,
cinder should tell all the portal addresses and corresponding
target iqns/luns.

With this patch initialize_connection API will return connection_info
with multiple portal addresses/iqns/luns when multipath=True is
specified in the connector info. For example:

  {"driver_volume_type": "iscsi",
   "data": {"target_portals": ["10.0.2.15:3260", "10.0.3.15:3260"],
            "target_iqns": ["iqn.2010-10.org.example:target-01",
                            "iqn.2010-10.org.example:target-02"],
            "target_luns": [1, 2],
            ...}}

This also modify brick/iscsi/connector.py to make the parameter
recognized and to login to every target.

In addition, this adds an config option
'iscsi_secondary_ip_addresses' to specify a list of secondary
portal addresses for LVM iSCSI Driver.

Implements: blueprint iscsi-multipath-enhancement
(cherry picked from commit ca97a7461f0f56835a0f2dceb9afaebac756f7c3)

Conflicts:
	cinder/brick/initiator/connector.py
	cinder/tests/brick/test_brick_connector.py
	cinder/tests/targets/test_tgt_driver.py
	cinder/tests/test_utils.py
	cinder/volume/driver.py
	cinder/volume/targets/iscsi.py
	cinder/volume/targets/lio.py
	cinder/volume/targets/tgt.py

Change-Id: Ic5e3ae5a8343b1a755369051f8cc08396e8616db
'}]
commit_message:
Enhance iSCSI multipath support

Currently, nova-compute and brick support multipath for iSCSI volume
data path. It depends on response to targets discovery of the main
iSCSI portal, expecting multiple portal addresses to be contained.

However, some arrays only respond to discovery with a single portal
address, even if secondary portals are available. In this case,
the connector cannot know secondary portals and corresponding
iSCSI target IQN, so cannot establish multiple sessions for
the target(s). To enable the connector to login to secondary portals,
cinder should tell all the portal addresses and corresponding
target iqns/luns.

With this patch initialize_connection API will return connection_info
with multiple portal addresses/iqns/luns when multipath=True is
specified in the connector info. For example:

  {"driver_volume_type": "iscsi",
   "data": {"target_portals": ["10.0.2.15:3260", "10.0.3.15:3260"],
            "target_iqns": ["iqn.2010-10.org.example:target-01",
                            "iqn.2010-10.org.example:target-02"],
            "target_luns": [1, 2],
            ...}}

This also modify brick/iscsi/connector.py to make the parameter
recognized and to login to every target.

In addition, this adds an config option
'iscsi_secondary_ip_addresses' to specify a list of secondary
portal addresses for LVM iSCSI Driver.

Implements: blueprint iscsi-multipath-enhancement
(cherry picked from commit ca97a7461f0f56835a0f2dceb9afaebac756f7c3)

Conflicts:
	cinder/brick/initiator/connector.py
	cinder/tests/brick/test_brick_connector.py
	cinder/tests/targets/test_tgt_driver.py
	cinder/tests/test_utils.py
	cinder/volume/driver.py
	cinder/volume/targets/iscsi.py
	cinder/volume/targets/lio.py
	cinder/volume/targets/tgt.py

Change-Id: Ic5e3ae5a8343b1a755369051f8cc08396e8616db

commit_message:
Describe how slave nodes choose the interface when PXE booting

This change contains the logic of PXE booting for slave nodes
and explains the situation with eth interfaces and physical device
numbers.

Change-Id: Ia9ce80cfff1718c2942263fca2ca68bb41e458b9
Closes-Bug: 1417801

in case a processors is tracking the state of a calculation
and you don't want to disrupt it.

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 2, 'name': 'Monty Taylor', 'email': 'mordred@inaugust.com', 'username': 'mordred'}, {'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 2750, 'name': 'Sean Dague', 'email': 'sean@dague.net', 'username': 'sdague'}, {'_account_id': 6786, 'name': 'Sergey Lukjanov', 'email': 'me@slukjanov.name', 'username': 'slukjanov'}, {'_account_id': 7710, 'name': 'Sergey Reshetnyak', 'email': 'sreshetniak@mirantis.com', 'username': 'sreshetniak'}, {'_account_id': 12038, 'name': 'Vitaly Gridnev', 'email': 'gridnevvvit@gmail.com', 'username': 'vgridnev'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-03-17 11:43:08.000000000', 'files': ['zuul/layout.yaml'], 'message': "Temp set saharaclient src juno job to non-voting

We've faced an issue with the job:

gate-tempest-dsvm-neutron-src-python-saharaclient-juno

and we need to investigate how it could be fixed. This job is now
not working on all sahara client CRs because of the Heat teamplate
initizialization failure. Heat engine checks the requirements
versions and find that sahara client installed from source and its
version isn't <=0.7.6 specified in requirements.txt file. This
failure is very strange and we currently not understand how it should
be fixed.

Change-Id: I60b558973ba77914b5c053f3c2b4da9aa076d043
"}]
commit_message:
Temp set saharaclient src juno job to non-voting

We've faced an issue with the job:

gate-tempest-dsvm-neutron-src-python-saharaclient-juno

and we need to investigate how it could be fixed. This job is now
not working on all sahara client CRs because of the Heat teamplate
initizialization failure. Heat engine checks the requirements
versions and find that sahara client installed from source and its
version isn't <=0.7.6 specified in requirements.txt file. This
failure is very strange and we currently not understand how it should
be fixed.

Change-Id: I60b558973ba77914b5c053f3c2b4da9aa076d043

commit_message:
Fix "Create network" explanation.

Update the following sentence to indicate that the request body is optional:

  This operation does not require a request body. The tenant ID
  that you specify in the URI is the tenant that creates the network.

Change-Id: I456f8b018d47d0995d27eeabadee7dafa7f362ee
Closes-Bug: #1426227
